subject: Stick 'Em With the Pointy End
event: Filming on HBO's GAME OF THRONES series will be resuming in June, in Northern Ireland. Maisie Williams, who will play Arya Stark, is preparing for her part by practicing her needlework. I though you might enjoy seeing these recent pictures of her that her mom was kind enough to send me. Her sword, of course, is the full-scale replica of Needle produced by the good folks at Valyrian steel. You can get a Needle for your very own Arya at http://www.valyriansteel.com/

props.taglist: a game of thrones, valyrian steel, hbo

comments.article: She really looks exactly as I pictured Arya from the books!
Agreed, she looks great!
Oh yes - she does look like Arya.  :)

She's too perfect. :D

Go Maisie Go! Stick 'em with the pointy end!!
She's such a great Arya!

WOW!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Accept for her rather... post-modern garb, that's like exactly as I imagine from the book. The sword, the setting, everything.. :)

BTW, it's time to rally up the ol' fan base again, George. Jaime needs help!
http://www.suvudu.com/2010/04/cage-match-2010-championship-5-rand-althor-versus-15-jaime-lannister.html
AWESOME! Cute and dangerous :)

comments.upictitle: Names Is For Tombstones, Baby: Rocketeer
comments.article:
You can get a Needle for your very own Arya at http://www.valyriansteel.com/

I would, but I don't have an Arya either.
What about an inner Arya? ;)
I can never imagine how things look in real life. I first pictured Needle as a rapier, and instead, I now see a sword that looks like its too much blade for me, let alone a child.

Historically-accurate rapiers are very long (often past 36 inches in length). Much longer than Needle, which according to Valyrian Steel's site has a mere 2' long blade.

Needle is not a rapier, though. It's more of a slimmed down cut-and-thrust sword, Mikken's idea of what a bravo's sword would look like.
Just like I imagined! Thanks for sharing. :o)

Oh, she looks absolutely perfect! Lethal, cute, and so very, very awesome~ (Can you tell Arya's my favorite character in the books? XD) I'm really looking forward to see Miss Williams in action~ ♥

The only thing is that I might have pictured Arya as very flat chested, but... That's such a minor thing it's hardly worth mentioning.

Oh, and Needle's a lot longer than I pictured it. Which is simply awesome! I can just imagine that little slip of a girl wielding a sword that size, and cutting down people on her 'list'. =D
you think that -isn't- flat chested? >.> she's just a little girl. nothing's grown in there at all, yet!
She is a perfect Arya.

Awesome. Just as I imagined. I think she's up there with Peter Dinklage in terms of how perfectly they seem to fit their role. Of course I've not seen her act yet, but I have high hopes.

I have a good feeling that just like in the books, Arya's going to be my favorite character in the television series.
comments.subject: Wow

comments.article: Is Maisie a lefty?
Is Maisie a lefty? Very fortuitous casting. Can't wait until we're introduced to Syrio Forel and have him say, "The left is good. All is reversed, it will make your enemies more awkward."
good memory hippo
Wow, she is perfectly cast. Great photos!
Nabokov would have asked "where can you get an Arya of your own" :)
Go Arya/Maisie! Stick 'em with the pointy end! *cheers gleefully*!
Adding to the disbelief, yeah that is exactly how I imagined her. Okay, so I think you describe her as having a long aquiline face, but I imagined her like this despite that. :P
She's so perfect. Totally love her!
To echo what others have said, that's a great casting. I notice that she's holding the sword in different hands in each picture. Practicing her ambidexterity? ;)
It's the same hand both times, she's just facing the opposite direction. :)
These are great pics, and Maisie definitely looks like I've pictured Arya.  Cannot wait to see this show!
comments.subject: She looks awesome!

comments.article:
Aw, she's so cute! I think my daughter would like Needle too, but I'm not going to let her close from one, she's way too clumsy XD

A really great Arya, indeed, who takes her role at heart too ♥

Dude, she IS Arya.  Poor kid.  I hope you and HBO have money saved for the therapy sessions these kids are going to need once the series is over in 7 years.  The girls who play Dany and Sansa are going to need vats of meds.

comments.upictitle: Agent Tomato: Only as good as his Hat
comments.article: She's PERFECT!
